intro: Tetrastigma crassipes var. strumarum, commonly known as the hairy passionvine, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
